===============

### **Vertical Transportation Preventive Maintenance Contract**

**Reference:** PW-22-01014876

**Tender Announcement:**
The National Capital Commission (NCC) invites tenderers to submit proposals for a preventive maintenance and services contract for ten (10) vertical transportation devices across the National Capital Region (NCR).

**Contract Details:**
The contract will have an initial term of three (3) years, with two (2) one-year option periods. The services will include, but not be limited to, regular maintenance, repairs, and inspections of the vertical transportation devices.

**Eligibility:**
All tenderers interested in participating in this contract are required to register with the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) and download the bid solicitation documents from the website.

**Key Dates:**

* **Publication Date:** 25 November 2022
* **Tender Closing Date:** 12 December 2022 (3:00 PM EST)
* **Amendment Date:** 6 December 2022

**Selection Criteria:**
The contract will be awarded to the bidder who best meets the mandatory requirements, including the lowest total evaluated price.

**Submissions:**
To ensure compliance with the tender, candidates must submit their proposals electronically via the National Capital Commission (NCC) Prosecurement Services at bids-soumissions@ncc-ccn.ca by the closing date and time. Late submissions will not be considered.

**Contact Information:**
For any inquiries or clarifications regarding this tender, please contact Emilie Scheckman, Senior Contract Officer, at emilie.scheckman@ncc-ccn.ca. 

**Attachments:**
The following documents are attached to this notice:

* ES024 - Addendum 1
* ES024 - Vertical Transportation Preventive Maintenance

### **Important Notes:**

* All bid packages and supporting information can be submitted in English or French.
* The site visits are not mandatory. However, the NCC may require site visits during the evaluation process.
* No public opening of bids is scheduled. 

Refer to the National Capital Commission's website for further information and updates on this tender opportunity: https://ncc-ccn.gc.ca/. 
You may also visit the Government Electronic Tendering Service (GETS) website for information and assistance: https://buyandsell.gc.ca/. 
Note: Please do not communicate with the evaluators via email to inquire about the status of your request or the evaluation process.
